decks.notes: This deck aims to utilize the Aluren combo to play multiple creatures for free, creating a value engine that overwhelms the opponent. By using cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Gilded Goose, the deck can quickly generate advantage and maintain control of the game. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay help protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of card draw, removal, and powerful creatures, this deck can quickly snowball out of control and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Oko, Thief of Crowns, while gaining card advantage with cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Young Pyromancer. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with Wastelands and dual lands, allowing the deck to quickly deploy threats and protect them from opposing answers.

The deck utilizes a combination of disruptive creatures and equipment to control the opponent's board while applying pressure. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to tax the opponent's spells and abilities, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck can use Flickerwisp to temporarily remove threats or reset problematic permanents. The equipment package of Batterskull, Umezawa's Jitte, and Sword of Fire and Ice provides additional threats and utility. Overall, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent while presenting a clock to close out the game.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void to control the opponent's spells, along with efficient mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to quickly deploy threats such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Plague Engineer also provides additional disruption, while cards like Karakas and Eldrazi Displacer offer ways to interact with the opponent's board. Overall, the focus is on aggressive and disruptive plays to outpace the opponent and secure victory.

This combo deck utilizes Elves to generate mana quickly and efficiently, allowing the player to cast powerful spells like Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order to win the game in a single turn. Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith help to draw through the deck and find the pieces needed for the combo. Cards like Allosaurus Shepherd and Nettle Sentinel provide protection and additional mana sources, while cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger help to untap creatures and generate even more mana. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive army of Elves and finish them off with a game-winning play.

The main focus of this deck is to use enchantress effects and combo pieces to control the game and ultimately win through a powerful end-game threat like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also utilizes disruptive enchantments like The Abyss and Engineered Plague to slow down the opponent's game plan. By ramping with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Abundant Growth, the deck aims to generate a lot of mana to cast its big threats while maintaining card advantage through cantrips and enchantress effects. Ultimately, the deck aims to control the game until it can drop a game-ending threat.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to utilize efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Brazen Borrower, while using cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for more threats and answers. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and the inclusion of cards like Daze and Wasteland helps in maintaining tempo advantage.

This deck utilizes a combination of Ninjas and Artifact creatures to quickly attack the opponent and generate card advantage through Yuriko's ability. The key strategy is to deploy small evasive creatures like Changeling Outcast and Ornithopter, then use Ninjas like Ingenious Infiltrator to bounce them back to hand and trigger their abilities. By blending aggression with card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents early while maintaining a steady stream of resources. The inclusion of counterspells and removal spells ensures that the deck can interact effectively with opposing strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling powerful creatures like Emrakul or Phyrexian Dreadnought onto the battlefield by utilizing the Show and Tell combo. This is complemented by disruptive cards like Stifle and Force of Will to protect the combo and ensure it resolves successfully. Oko provides additional utility and control elements, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig for key pieces. The deck also includes some sideboard options like Plague Engineer and Veil of Summer to further tailor its strategy against a variety of matchups in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Phyrexian Dreadnought into play using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. It also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Stifle to protect the combo. The deck also has some flexibility with Oko, Thief of Crowns providing additional value and control options. The key strategy is to quickly get a big threat into play while disrupting opposing strategies, aiming to win the game before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

The deck relies on the powerful combo of Sneak Attack and Show and Tell to cheat out game-winning creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It uses cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Preordain to dig through the deck quickly and find the necessary pieces to assemble the combo. With disruptive elements like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to protect the combo, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm its opponent with massive threats that can end the game in a single turn.
